title: Introduction
text:
In this presentation I will discuss the advantage of using RStudio projects and Github repositories.


RStudio is an integrated development environment for R and Python. It was created by and administered by posit.
Overall, RStudio allows:

Deveoping and testing code
Data visualization
Package constructions
Production of documents (pdf, .doc, html) based on R markdown or Quarto scripts
Development of websites

renv is a dependencies manager that favors isolation of RStudio projects and code reproducibility.
Github ‘is a platform and cloud-based service for software development and version control using Git, allowing developers to store and manage their code.’
All our RStudio projects can be stored on Github as repositories following the same project structure. To connect RStudio with Github some basic use of terminal and LINUX language is needed.
Github Desktop (GD) is a desktop application that facilitates exchange of data between Github and RStudio.

All our RStudio projects can be stored on Github as repositories following the same project structure. To connect RStudio with Github some basic use of terminal and LINUX language is needed.
Github Desktop (GD) is a desktop application that facilitates exchange of data between Github and RStudio.

title: About
text: This demo website will be used to discuss the advantages of creating repositories for your RStudio projects on Github.com
